duties_responsibilities.duty: Receive and prepare samples for laboratory analysis and tests.
Perform required quality control and train on all areas including Specimen Processing, Chemistry, Serology, UA, Coag, and Parasitology.
Enter and release test results and participate in departmental training programs.
Read UA slides, perform tests such as CBC, Progesterone, PT, PTT, Platelet count, Reticulocytes, TB, T4, FCV, HWAB, Accuplex, HW, FELV, and Giardia ELISA.
Participate in enterprise initiatives, special projects, and other duties as assigned.
Ensure ethical conduct and reporting of concerns/violations of company policy or ethical standards.
Drive staffing and workforce planning efforts and work with Talent Acquisition on assessing needs and competencies for new openings.
Maintain in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring compliance.
Assist in the recruitment of designated positions and provide day-to-day performance management guidance to line management.
Improve work relationships, build morale, increase productivity, and retention.
Ensure documentation/paperwork is in place for new hires, promotions, transfers, and terminations.

education_certification.credential: Associates/Bachelor’s Degree in Science related field or Veterinary Technician with a minimum of 1 year clinical laboratory experience
